This game is a [b] lot [/b] of fun (with & without friends) but it is [i]kinda[/i] a hot mess to learn how to play though. 

Auric Cells, Bloodpoints, Gold Coins, Iridescent Shards, Putrid Serum, & Rift Fragments. You're probably like what are these random words, and what do they really mean? Those are the different currencies of the game and you now know as much as I do for 5 of them (I have 60+ hours). Its great, I love it. 

To be honest the less you know, the more fun it is and for even more fun... don't even bother looking at end game chat [strike](cause it can be toxic as hell)[/strike]. 

[h1] 10/10 [/h1]  
[i] Would slug myself on a deranking killer again.[/i]

Ive played this game on and off since its release and Ill say this; ITS TOXIC. Players abuse mechanics and generally are just poor sports. If youre looking for a balanced and enjoyable game look some where else. This aint it chief.
god tier game. layered like an onion

Now in 2021: Still the same thing. Salty players still telling me to kill myself.
This game is absolutely incredible, if you want to play a game that can cause a wave of emotions dead by daylight is that game.

i came to l√©ry's memorial institute for stomach problems, as i was out of town. i was quickly put into a room with dr. carter. the tools were dirty, it smelled horrible, and someone else was present in the room even after i protested. i was reassured that the man wouldn't bother me due to his gaping head wound.
i woke up two days later in a bag on the side of the road in pennsylvania speaking in a french accent with no memory of who i was, only regaining my memory after my family blew up my phone when i reached a place with service
i do not recommend going to l√©ry's memorial institute, even in a grave emergency. however, i liked the lollipops that ended up in my pockets when i turned up in pennsylvania. 2/10 stars.

With almost 900 hours in this piece of dogshit game I will say it is the one of the most frustratingly unfun games on steam. You are playing a multiplayer game that requires full teamwork with ZERO COMMUNICATION WHATSOEVER besides teabagging and pointing..Not even a fucking chatbox.. On top of that, Behavior nerfed all the good survivor items/addons. No amount of licensed killers and/or new maps can save this miserable shit fest.
Fun game definately makes you jump. this is currently my most played game and will probably stay that way.
Great fun to meme around with friends, or to take a bit more seriously online. Great if you love horror films!

Do I recommend DBD? NOPE. Never. Couldn't pay me enough to. People have brains. Use it and buy something else.
I'm a survivor main. I have some killer experience, but killer is boring to me. I've played for 2-3 years. 1,266.4 hours. I hate this game. I would not recommend it to Anybody. The first and last paragraphs will say the general idea. The rest are more informative.

I'm gonna go ahead and waste time writing this so at least it potentially helps one person not absolutely Waste their money on this game and buy something worthwhile instead. Long story short: We'll talk about the toxicity of the matches, the community, the garbage updates the team of DBD makes, how they ignore their community as much as they possibly can (and no, looking at data and making some 15 minute survey does not mean they care about their community. Only the data it provides.), how they are Not consumer friendly, their garbage report system (not that you can report for much that you Should be able to report anyway), and how, in short, they do not care who you are, what you think, or how you feel. (Unless you're a twitch streamer, because then they get publicity!) -_-

Toxic Matches.
As I mentioned, I'm a survivor main. So my main points will be on that, and well, in killer matches I don't see anything super toxic other than survivors using good perks/items. In my survivor matches (and plenty other peoples'), you'll experience campers who won't leave you when you're hooked, slugging (when they down everyone in the match and no one can do anything), and tunneling. Tunneling being the worst imo, where you are followed right after you get saved, hooked again, and repeat until you die in about 2 minutes or less. Enjoy your 2 minute game. And all of these things are fine with DBD. They do not care. They do not care if this ruins your experience, or the game for you in general. They don't wanna hear it. So your two options are to either shut up and deal with it, or quit the game, which is fine. No one will miss you anyway.

Reports?
 Reports don't do anything. Unless it's against one of their precious twitch streamers or something, they couldn't care less. If you want to report the people who Ruin the game, nope. Harassment? Nothing will get done. They have a report system, sure, but you almost NEVER see anything done with it. I'm sure the community has asked for someone to care of course, but you can't just ask people working there a serious question and expect an intelligent, serious answer. Or an answer at all, rather.

Updates. 
Once you or someone you know plays the game, you'll understand. They do "killer reworks." Freddy used to be a weak killer. They upgraded him and now he's very strong. Very easy to play like a jerk and ruin every survivor's matches. The survivors have shown they don't like how he plays, and often times give possible solutions (which are almost always better than the DBD team's), but again, no one cares or listens. Screw the community, am I right? They put in updates to fix or change things, and then say "Nice, we did something productive. Doing pretty good so far!" Even though most of the time the updates suck and only make things worse. They don't care. They only go by their data. You. Do. Not. Matter.

Not Consumer Friendly.
DBD is usually around $20. They have a Rift system. In all honesty, I don't think it's all that bad. You can purchase in game currency, Auric Cells, and for $10, you can buy the Rift system. You gain an extra 100 Auric Cells back per Rift if you complete it. Now onto Cosmetics. With the new Silent Hill chapter coming out, they've added a new type of cosmetic. Legendary Sets. You do not get to mix and match these with other cosmetics, and they cost $10 worth of Auric Cells. Remember how I said DBD was $20?... And a set that you can't even mix and match with other cosmetics costs you $10? I'd rather buy Idk, a milkshake and some fries and still have money left over. Other cosmetics do cost lots of Auric Cells, so don't leave those out. Some, however, you have the option to also buy with Iridescent Shards, which are another type of in game currency you earn by playing games. I'll briefly mention how the game is GRIND HELL and you barely get ANYTHING per match. This includes Shards. Oh well.

In the end I hate this game. I have 1,266.4 current hours on the game. I have wasted so much time on this piece of trash game. I hope you don't. :) Use your money to buy a game that cares about the community, has a nicer community, is consumer friendly, and overall Fun. Or just save it... up to you man. o.o

Update: I forgot to mention how every update they do brings twice as many bugs as before, how they're involving NFTs in their game (and sugarcoating their involvement), and how they're not giving a single care about players' safety when hackers are now flooding this game and doxxing it's playerbase to gather their IP addresses. Honestly, it's pathetic.
